author: jtrube
title: Educating Local Japanese Government
description: Local governments in Japan are looking for new and innovative ways to revitalize depopulated areas and serve their aging communities. Cardano and blockchain tech are rarely considered as solutions.

f6_assessments.q0:
Responding to an issue identified in a community, town, city, region by using the cardano technology, would be a great way to get it adopted, and onboard new people to be get interest to the ecosystem and then submit proposal to be funded through the project catalyst.
The proposers team has identified depopulation and aging community as two of major issues in Japan and they would like to produce information resources by videos to share with with policy makers and elected officials on how the cardano ecosystem may be a solution to give answers to those identified issues.
The idea behind this proposal may have an impact to the cardano and also be scalable and globally expandable as officials may adopt and start putting in place new initiatives to solve those issue based on the cardano technology, which is one of the objectives of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The agency that will collaborate with the proposers team has a long experience in developing relations between brands, companies and the community. Their expertise may be used throughout this project implementation to develop ideas to be shared with the public officials.
On another side, this should need a well explained approach strategy to be used by proposers to connect with those officials, that may facilitate their by-in, which is needed for adoption.
This proposer seems to be a second phase of another one submitted by almost the same team with title: ''Local Japanese Government Strategy'' that intends to consult the elected officials and policy makers around the same issues through workshops and sessions in order together, develop some ideas that would be presented in a report on how cardano technology may be used to offer solutions to the depopulation and community aging issue.
As you can see, the videos would be created based on concrete actions identified and facilitated by cardano. That way official would easily understand the necessity of adopting it. But just taking it as a stand alone initiative, this proposal may not develop video that will attract interest of the targeted group.
The videos to be created, will have what contents, and this will be created by whom?
The timeframe is reasonable and a budget with global numbers without much details on expense items. As for the proposers team, they have experience and have been working on other previous proposal funded by the project catalyst, but they haven't revealed their level implication in the cardano ecosystem, catalyst community. This would help people know that the team knows how the grand process works within that community.
The proposal appears being feasible to me, but I feel there are some important ides missing. It's full of theory than action oriented, and I would encourage proposers to implement it in a 2nd phase of the other one I've mentioned above. That's why I rate it with a 3 star.
f6_assessments.q2:
The ^roject will last 4 months, and after each, a report will be produced to present what was accomplished during that period of time, but practically, no action is presented as deliverable. an dhow this would be tracked with KPI's. While the community dos not know where will it be going to follow the progress of this project.
I'm not sure this information would allow to make an objective evaluation of the auditability. And for that, I rate with a 3 star.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem being Japanese local governments are searching for new innovative ways to serve their aging communities and revitalize depopulated areas but for this cardano and blockchain technology aren't considered as solution due to the lack of knowledge. The proposal is trying to resolve this but creating series of video contents that would educate local Japanese governments about Cardano and its ecosystem. This would help local Japanese governments to consider cardano as one of the ways to serve their aging communities and revitalize depopulated areas.
If implemented successfully by the local governement this would help to onboard new members and grow cardano ecosystem. Therefore the proposal does address the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer hasn't provided any experience or skills related to video content creation and I wasn't able to find any video content on their website but they do have experience creating marketing content that should be helpful due to this I have deducted one star. The proposer has given a clear plan and complete budget breakdown. The budget demanded seems justified and the proposer has considered all the key risks that would effect implementation of the proposal. Hence it's likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal do consist of a clear step by step to implement with a complete time horizon which will be helpful to track the progress of the proposal. The proposer has given details regarding how success will look like and monthly targets to measure the success of the proposal. They have also provided a clear budget breakdown considering all the expenses which may occur. With all these it is safe to say the information provided should be enough to measure the progress and the success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: My first observation on this project is that, there is a disconnect between the problem statement and the solution. That’s the problem statement is not well captured to show the existence of a problem. However, we can infer from the solution, what the problem is. What’s the main idea here? The objective of this project is  educate local Japanese government officials on the Cardano blockchain technology. In spite of Cardano presence in Asia, I think the workload in ensuring the growth of the Cardano community in Asia is very enormous, therefore this project presents the opportunity to create more awareness of the potentials and opportunities the cardano ecosystem presents in helping governments devise solutions that meet local expectations. Ultimately,  this presents the opportunity to improve the lives of the aging communities in Japan and to make the world a better place, an objective of the grow Cardano, grow Asia challenge setting. Therefore, I am convinced that this project addresses the challenge. However, I suggest the proposer reframe the problem statement to make it more understandable.
f6_assessments.q1: The team profile presented by the proponent is very thorough and comprehensive. Obviously the expertise of the team, as indicated would be relevant to this project. A project that is education based would definitely require the marketing experience of the team. To add to that,  the proposer provides attached external links that confirms the credentials of the team. Apart from that, I think the team has presented a detailed roadmap that shows clearly the activities that would be carried out from start to finish of this project. By this work structure, we’re able to monitor the activities, given that there are specified timeframe for each activity listed. Similarly, the budget looks very concise and informative . The proposer has indeed provided a breakdown of  budget allocation. Per the information provided, we know all the relevant resources required for this project and their various cost. I think the amount allocation here is very reasonable and represents an accurate reflection of the actual cost of these items.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided for auditability could be improved. The proposer presents a clear framework of the milestones required at each stage of the roadmap. In respect of that, the proposer presents a strategy to record data on these milestones at each phase of the roadmap. However, would the team also make available these information to the community  and how? Aside that, I wish the team improve the KPIs to make more aligned to the success of the project. In that regard, I suggest the team include indicators like, was the solution adopted, what is the feedback from government and a few others. I recommend that the team make these information available to the community via the social media channels such as telegram and discord.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal describes the production of videos describing Cardano and Catalyst to help the Japanese local government consider innovation in the region. I think that the impact that this project has on East Asian residents is low because at the high level like a state agency or government apparatus, it will guide the law (for the long term) rather than directly affect the way people live develop a project to develop Japanese residents. In addition, I have not yet realized how well the local government absorbs news because blockchain is only one part of their many concerns about social security as well as national development. Therefore, the information conveyed in the video is not highly impactful as well as creating the urgency to immediately change the policies coming from the local government. And so, the value we get in return is very little. Besides, the goal this challenge sponsors is to be able to see immediate results in the short term rather than something vague at the leadership levels.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal does not clarify what content for the video will need to be implemented. An overly sketchy implementation roadmap, simply sourcing equipment and studios. I suggest that it is better to detail the stages to be performed, presented in the form of small to large headings forming a whole. This will help us have an overall view to follow the set plan and limit errors.
The budget for the project is also not really detailed, I still can't figure out why the audio fee is $600? the same goes for other costs mentioned in the proposal. I want to emphasize here that it needs to be detailed so that the community can correctly judge whether such a cost is reasonable or not? Is there anything more to add?
Therefore, the feasibility I think is average
f6_assessments.q2: Indicators to measure progress as well as achieved results should be concretized into metrics for ease of audit. For example, the proposed group has made 30 videos and communicated to local authorities, or has good community feedback. That is, we must have metrics to measure rather than vague notions of success as clearly communicated.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal gives solution to create a series of videos to educate local Japanese government about what Cardano and Catalyst can offer them to help them revitalize depopulated areas and serve their aging communities. Cardano and blockchain technology are rarely seen as the solution to creativity and innovation in Japan. Therefore, the project will attract officials and policymakers in Japan. The project will provide educational videos to detail the knowledge and resources that Japanese local governments need in order to consider Cardano for innovation.They were thus able to convey Cardano and Catalyst's message directly to decision-makers and influencers in the Japanese government. This is a fresh approach, different from traditional media, PR or awareness campaigns.The successful project will help grow Cardano's ecosystem in Japan, thus aligning with the goal of the challenge. The project presents a risk associated with project participants whose appearance and reputation become concerns so may face challenges related to disclosure of identity and information but the project has not yet delivered ways to reduce it.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project has an implementation time of 4 months: the first month of building Branding and visuals, the second month: Programming and talent; the 3rd month: Sourcing equipment, technology and preparing studio and the 4th month will be Shooting and editing. The project come up with an idea to make educational videos to present about Cardano, Catalyst, but I have not seen how many videos the presentation project will make, how long each video will be, and what content will be presented, how the videos will reach the local Japanese government…In addition, the jobs performed each month should be more specific and clear to serve the educational video making solution as described above.

The project requires a budget of 10,000 USD, including expenses such as talent $ 2,000, sound $ 600, studio $ 2,000, script writing $ 1,000, project management costs $ 1,000 ...The project does not specify how many videos will be made, how many minutes each video will be, what content will be presented, etc., so it is difficult to assess the reasonableness of these costs.

The project team are Nick Clarke - an international creative and marketing specialist specializing in events, marketing and PR; Ryu Ishimori - an exhibition and events specialist with extensive experience in planning, marketing, design, construction and operations. These 2 people have qualifications and experience in marketing, events, PR, but it is not clear if these 2 people have knowledge of blockchain, cardano, catalyst.They should combine with qualified, knowledgeable people about Cardano, Catalyst to implement the project. In the cost section, there is a cost for talent, writing a script, not sure if it is the cost of hiring a specialist?
f6_assessments.q2: The project states the tasks to be completed at each milestone from the first month to the fourth month as the first month will be a report on branding and image, the second month will be programming and talent (names and schedules)…but the project has not stated how the community can monitor the progress and results of the project. The solution proposed by the project is to make educational videos, the project should state the results of the project as to how many videos can be made, how many minutes each video will be, and what knowledge will be taught to local authorities.

f6_assessments.q0: While the idea is good and could potentially have an important impact on Cardano's presence in Japan, I believe there isn't enough information on how the proposers will put it into practice. Dealing with the government is hardly easy, it involves politics, and many stakeholders with different goals... so I believe the project should be more robust in order for it to work. When it comes to the risks, I believe it should be considered the lack of interest from the governments, for example, or a bureaucracy that was not thought in cryptocurrencies.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the milestones could be more detailed. I think there is a focus on content production, but there is no mention of marketing, talking to governments, networking, etc. The same goes for the budget, where marketing and transportation to/from meetings don't seem to be included. The proposers seem experienced, and I believe they might have the right skills for this project.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some key metrics to measure content creation, but I think there should be some metrics regarding contact with the governments, and how the content will be used. I believe it is hard to track if the project's end goal will be reached if only content production is being measured.

f6_assessments.q0: As it’s also mentioned in the summit, Cardano does have a long-term plan for Japan and to explore its potential. So having said that, this proposal does align their project with the challenge by creating a campaign program that associates themselves with the local government (especially, the one that already shows cooperation) and hopefully will be able to bring a more significant impact. It also aligns itself with the Cardano goal for mass adoption by creating more exposure to the general public to familiarize themselves with the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does provide the key member profiles and Linkedin links to each of them and has experience proven by their work on their website. Eggworm, the company that write this proposal has been standing for quite some time and having the support of the local government further proves their credibility, The budget is outlined and listed in the category, but the budget allocation lacks detail. How many people will work on it? How many work hours will it be? Aside from that, the roadmap is explained on monthly basis. The first 1 - 4 months basically mentioned what they will do but more details probably will offer more support, like are they going to do it all in-house? Or is there going to be a potential partner or vendor? Providing those details will results in a better understanding of how the fund will be utilized.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers did state that they will have a bit of difficulty in providing full transparency for a reasonable cause, and those will probably need to be mitigated further down the line. Other than their website, they don’t provide much. Probably providing more references or links to give better assurance will be best, their website does entail the links to social media, taking into consideration that except for the Facebook links, both their Instagram and the Twitter page don’t exist. Aside from that, their methods to provide auditability regarding the progress are quite straightforward by giving report updates and photo evidence periodically.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposers have an idea to assist the Japanese Government in regards to revitalizing depopulated areas and serving their aging communities.

However, it was not clearly mentioned or explained how this project will help or become the solution for the Japanese Government. so it would be best if the proposer could make it more detailed what the project’s aim is to assist the Japanese government. 

In fact, reading from the proposal, it seems that the proposer wants to educate/ socialize Cardano to Japanese government.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer of this project is a company named Eggworm, which has been operated in Japan in terms of Branding. Reading from the website given, www.eggworm.jp, this company has a good portfolio for branding activities in Japan. as well as the proposer has mentioned 2 team members who have expertise in marketing experts. It is strongly suggested to involve a team member who understands blockchain to this project. since the goal is to make the Japanese aware of Blockchain and the Cardano community.

The budget requested is $10000 and broken down well into activities and positions. Looking at this budget breakdown, this budget is reasonable.  

The proposal has outlined targeted activities from month 1 to month 4.

Risks and challenges are mentioned in this proposal such as public perception in Japanese business and politics. However, it would be great if the proposer could suggest a mitigation plan for the potential risks.
f6_assessments.q2:
The timeline for this project is outlined, however it could be more detailed such as what branding and visuals will be done as a target in month 1 and so on.

The problem was that Japan is depopulated areas and aging communities, and this project does not mention anything about a plan to solve this problem using Blockchain or the Cardano community.

f6_assessments.q0: Unlike other proposals, the main target audience of this proposal is the local governments in Japan. The project aims to provide new ideas and solutions to the local governments through Cardano and Catalyst. This assist will them in revitalizing neighborhoods and serving their aging communities. The local governments in Japan start innovating with Cardano will be a breakthrough for the Japanese Cardano community, helping the community have a firmer belief in Cardano. Moreover, this will change the negative thinking of many people and make them have a more positive view towards the blockchain technologies in general and Cardano in particular.
f6_assessments.q1: To be honest,  the two main members who will work on the project seem very good and competent. However, their background is quite vague and they seem to have never worked in the blockchain and crypto space. Therefore, they can be considered as inexperienced in this field. As can be seen from the proposal, the plan that the proposed team came up with can be said to be very sketchy and the allocation of the budget was equally sketchy. So much so that I can't imagine on what basis the costs are calculated. As stated in the proposal, the project may face some risks but the team doesn't seem to have any solutions to deal with them yet.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, this section was also written too general and not specific. I recommend the team to include specific metrics and KPIs. This is quite important because it will show the quality of each stage that the team implements. Hence, the community can rely on that to have a more comprehensive assessment.

f6_assessments.q0: The issue brought up in this proposal is the lack of awareness from local Japanese governments of Cardano and blockchain as a way to revitalize depopulated areas and aging communities. The proposed solution is to make a video series about Cardano and Catalyst to educate local Japanese governments, While the idea and goal of this project can add value to Cardano by raising awareness of local communities in Japan, the content planned in the proposal seems very general. For example, the proposer mentioned that the videos will present “what Cardano and Catalyst has to offer them” and “the knowledge and resources needed in order to consider Cardano for innovation” but didn’t explain further on what will be presented exactly (i.e. the opportunity in blockchain, the advantages of Cardano, the technical knowledge needed, etc.). Without these information regarding the content of the videos, it is hard to judge whether the information can be communicated properly to the recipient, in this case the local Japanese governments.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team members have the experience in terms of conducting a marketing/PR events, judging by the LinkedIn provided. However, there were lack of mentions regarding their experience with Cardano to prove that they have the necessary knowledge to be presented to the local government. 

The 4 months roadmap provides a monthly timeline but lacks details regarding its respective milestones. For example, the 1st month will be used for “branding and visuals” but there were no mentions on what the specific branding entails, such as what marketing strategy will be done? is it a website? social media account? posters? or campaign?. The same can be said for some of the other milestones (i.e. what does programming and talent entails? how many talents will be recruited? how many videos will be made? etc.). The timeline is overall ambiguous on the specific activities that will be done and make it hard to judge the feasibility of the roadmap completion.

The budget was broken down into identifiable items but it lacks information regarding its cost justification. For example, the budget for talents, editing, script writing, direction, and management lacks explanation of total workhours, requested hourly rate, number of people involved on each item, etc. I think adding these information is really important so that the budget can be evaluated properly.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics chosen to track the project progress are adequate which includes reports of evidence for branding, talent names and program schedules, equipment and studio procurement, as well as number of videos made. Information regarding how these metrics will be reported (i.e. what platform and frequency of report) would be appreciated. Additionally, I think adding  KPIs to measure the reception and quality of the program is very important for measuring the success of the project, which is lacking at the moment. For example, this can be done through a feedback form regarding how helpful the information is, how well it is delivered, and how willing the local governments are to consider Cardano, etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal wants to introduce Cardano to the government of Japan by the way of making educational videos about Cardano/ Catalyst. I rate the score 3 for its impact because the proposal has a very nice intention to drive more adoption of Cardano, but the plan has not been written clear enough at some points:
- Which regions the proposal is focused on.
- What is the content that will be put in those educational videos.
- As written in the proposal, the team has been contacted by the local government in Japan. It would be better if the proposer inform readers whether it is because the government is curious about Cardano, or if the team has the government's contact. If it's just the latter point, the plan to approach the government about blockchain Cardano is another thing, much more difficult.
f6_assessments.q1:
(1) The team has two members, who both have experience in the media/ marketing fields. It would be better if the team members inform more about their roles/ experience in the Catalyst/ Cardano system. It is because to educate the government, we not only need a professional marketing campaign but we also need someone who really understands the ecosystem.
(2) The budget has been broken down but the scope of work has not been divided clearly as to who does each role.
(3) The proposal should have added the risks and challenges in approaching the government.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has set some metrics for success, but I think they should be more specific. For instance, how many Japanese regions have been reached out, how many people get onboarded Cardano, and what programmes might be conducted using Cardano to help the ageing communities.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes I agree. The idea here is to educate local governments in Japan about blockchain and Cardano specifically for the purpose of developing (revitalizing) depopulated areas and serving aging communities. The success of this could considerably and positively impact the local life of the Japanese (very important element of the challenges) and in addition it would allow the expansion of the Cardano ecosystem. I think this proposal effectively meets the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The goal is for local governments across Japan to be presented with new ideas on how to revitalize depopulated areas and serve their aging communities via Cardano and Catalyst. 

By consulting their site via the proposed link, by focusing on their way of working, we realize that there is the skill necessary to carry out this proposal successfully, however a small problem arises in the plan. It is true that the activities follow each other in a coherent way, however they stop at the level of "shooting and editing" the content. We do not know how to see in the key stages how they plan to approach the competent authorities to finally instruct them and achieve the objective pursued. 

The team presents the difficulties related to the disclosure of information and/or identities as a potential risk that could prevent the successful completion of the proposal, however the team does not explain how they intend to mitigate this risk. 

Finally personally I find that this proposal remains a major opportunity for expansion of Cardano and its ecosystem in East Asia, however there are some important elements that are not clearly defined.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, I believe that the information provided will verify the progress and success of the proposal. The team offers to provide reports of the work done during the month. I find this approach to be better in the sense that they have set goals to achieve each month in their plan.

solution: We will create a series of videos designed to educate local Japanese governments on everything Cardano and Catalyst has to offer them.
experience: Eggworm is a brand experience agency that has spent over a decade establishing valuable working relationships between brands, companies and communities in Japan. We create experiences that empower our partners and bring their brand stories to life.
